original_title: Sri Lanka Customs earns Rs970bn in 2023 despite import restrictions
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Customs earned 970 billion rupees in 2023, its highest earnings, the government department said in a statement issued this week.

“At the beginning of 2023, the Ministry of Finance set a revenue target of 1,217 billion rupees for Customs but this was revised to 893 billion because of the country’s financial situation,” Sri Lanka Customs Media Spokesman, Seevali Arukgoda, said.
“We exceeded the revised target by 109 percent; it’s 80 percent of the initial target.”
Arukgoda pointed out that Customs revenue was impacted due to the import restrictions on vehicles imposed by the government amidst the forex crisis.
“In 2023, customs could only earn 10 billion rupees from the import of vehicles,” Arukgoda said.

The previous highest revenue earned by Sri Lanka Customs was in 2018 when it recorded 923 billion rupees. There were no import restrictions at the time. Customs earned 180 billion rupees from vehicle imports alone, Arukgoda said.
“In 2022, the revenue target for Customs was 730 billion rupees of which it earned 708 billion rupees. So, compared to 2022, 2023 shows an income growth of about 138 percent.” (Colombo/Jan3/2024)
